description:
On August 13th 2020, Andorra's Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, and the Minister of Education and Higher Education, Ester Vilarrubla, appeared this Thursday to present the protocol designed by both ministries for the return to the classrooms this September. 
 UPDATE: The start date of the school year for kindergarten and primary education courses is maintained on September 9 and is set for September 14 for the rest of higher education.

description: On the 27th of May, 2020, the Minister of Health and the Minister of Education announced the reopening of schools the following week, on the 2nd of June, 2020. Students will be needed to organize in nuclear groups, within which they will be able to interact freely, but security measures such as masks and distancing will be needed when interacting with other groups.

description: On April 16th, Andorra, has adopted a unique way of easing lockdown restrictions. Those who live in even-numbered homes are allowed to go out on even dates, while those who reside in odd-numbered homes on all other days. Houses without a number will go out on even dates if the name of occupants begins with A-M, and odd days if it starts with N-Z. Running or walking fast can take place between 6 am and 9 am or from 6 pm to 9 pm. Andorrans can shop or stroll between 9 am and 11 am or between 2 pm and 7 pm. The time between 11 am and 2 pm is reserved for vulnerable and elderly populations to get out of the house.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

The time between 11 am and 2 pm is reserved for vulnerable and elderly populations to get out of the house.
 UPDATE: This policy has ended.

description:
On April 16th, Andorra, has adopted a unique way of easing lockdown restrictions. Those who live in even-numbered homes are allowed to go out on even dates, while those who reside in odd-numbered homes on all other days. Houses without a number will go out on even dates if the name of occupants begins with A-M, and odd days if it starts with N-Z. Running or walking fast can take place between 6 am and 9 am or from 6 pm to 9 pm. Andorrans can shop or stroll between 9 am and 11 am or between 2 pm and 7 pm. The time between 11 am and 2 pm is reserved for vulnerable and elderly populations to get out of the house.
 UPDATE: The Government still requires people to stay at home but measures have been relaxed. People are allowed to go walking, running and to carry out sports activities in the mountains, such as hiking, running or fishing. They can choose between going out one hour every day or two hours on alternate days depending on the building numbers. Cycling as a means of transport is permitted. UPDATE: The Government still requires people to stay at home but measures have been relaxed. description: On 11 March, the Andorran Government declares a "sanitary emergency" in the country. UPDATE: Spokesman Eric Jover said in an appearance on Wednesday evening that the Executive had extended the exceptional measures due to the health emergency caused by the new SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus with no expiration date. Thus, the actions will be maintained until the Government agrees to leave them without effect. UPDATE: Spokesman Eric Jover said in an appearance on Wednesday evening that the Executive had extended the exceptional measures due to the health emergency caused by the new SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus with no expiration date. Thus, the actions will be maintained until the Government agrees to leave them without effect.

description: On September 11, 2020, Andorra's Minister of Social Affairs, Housing and Youth, Víctor Filloy, together with the Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, chaired the second meeting of the Sociosanitary Monitoring Commission (COSS) this Friday morning. The meeting allowed to decide, in a joint and coordinated way between the participants, the extension of the security measures in the Sociosanitary Centers of the country. Among the new decisions used, the extension of COVID-19 detection tests among the workers of the centers will be carried out from now on every fortnight.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On Monday, April 6, 2020. Andorra's Minister Jover has reported the arrival in the country of medical equipment from France and China. the Hospital Nostra Senyora de Meritxell has been included as another hospital within the Groupement Hospitalier de Territoire des Pyrénnées Ariégeoises. This allows Andorra to supply itself according to its needs. In this first consignment, which has been collected in Foix, has allowed the arrival of 3,800 FFP2 masks and 16,350 surgical masks.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Masks

description: In two weeks from April 6th 2020, Andorra will launch the first phase of deconfinement of the population through tests which will concern all the inhabitants of the Principality. By testing its entire population, Andorra will seek to determine the level of coronavirus infection in the Principality. For this, Andorra will carry out rapid tests which will make it possible to determine whether the subject has developed antibodies to fight against the Covid-19 coronavirus. Depending on the evolution of the coronavirus in the Principality, Andorra will then initiate the second phase of deconfinement. with the gradual opening up of personal services and economic activities.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Andorra's health authorities will screen the children and monitors of the Escaldes-Engordany Summer Sports. The health authorities have detected a total of 7 positives, 5 from the same cohabiting unit and 2 related, in the Summer Sports of the parish of Escaldes-Engordany. The epidemiological survey and traceability are currently being carried out and an operation is being coordinated, together with the municipality of Escaldes-Engordany, to screen all children and monitors of summer sports.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Andorra's  Minister of Health reports on the exceptional measures to deal with the infection with the new coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) relating to the recommendations for playgrounds.These recommendations are established to minimize the risk of transmission of SARS-CoV-2 infection in these spaces. Specifically:
- It is recommended that users of these equipments carry out hand hygiene before and after using them, or use hydroalcoholic gel.
- The use of a mask is recommended, depending on the instructions of the health authorities.
- It is necessary to avoid that agglomerations in these equipments occur.- It is necessary to guarantee the frequent cleaning of the facilities.
type_sub_cat: Hygiene measures for public areas
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On September 3rd 2020, Andorra's Ministry of Social Affairs, Housing and Youth has today delivered 1,000 devices to open doors, made of 3D printed polylactic acid material and provided to the Ministry part of the Department of Mobility, the Federation of the Elderly of Andorra . The purpose of these devices is to prevent the person using them from touching doors, elevator buttons or other public elements that could lead to a risk of SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus infection.

description: On March 22 2020, Andorra's government and Minister of Spokesperson Eric Jover explained in the press conference that, given the exceptional situation arising from the health crisis, which has led to the application of restrictions on the mobility of people, the use of national transport lines has been reduced. Thus, the internal lines will be reduced to one vehicle every hour in the morning, noon and night strips.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On Friday, March 13 2020, Andorra's government made a special announcement regarding exceptional measures being taken to combat the COVID-19 pandemic. From tomorrow Saturday and for an extendable period of up to 15 days it is decreed the closure of all leisure establishments, and all commercial establishments, with the exception of those that sell basic necessities. All those formalities or actions that are not urgent will have to be postponed until the end of these measures.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

update_level_var: [travel_mechanism] of policy relaxing ; timing of policy strengthening
description: On Friday, March 13 2020, Andorra's government made a special announcement regarding exceptional measures being taken to combat the COVID-19 pandemic. From tomorrow Saturday and for an extendable period of up to 15 days it is decreed the closure of all leisure establishments, and all commercial establishments, with the exception of those that sell basic necessities. All those formalities or actions that are not urgent will have to be postponed until the end of these measures. UPDATE: On April 16, 2020, the government started easing lockdown measures by allowing the population to leave the house on alternate days, with different timeslots for various activities ranging from exercise to shopping. They are also allowed to walk with a maximum of five people living in the same home.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On, Wednesday, March 4, 2020, The Andorran Government, at the proposal of the Minister of Health, Joan Martinez Benazet, has approved the Decree of the Regulation of the economic benefits for all those people who are under observation, either at home due to the risk of exposure to the virus, or hospitalized with suspicion of this condition, will receive the CASS sickness benefit and thus will have their medical leave covered.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_text: Economic policy providing benefits to those in isolation due to Covid
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People with certain health conditions (please note which health conditions in the text entry)

description: "Andorra Government declares  the omnibus law will inject 200 million into the economy".

description: On Wednesday, March 25, 2020, The Andorran Government has agreed with the Andorran Banking Association, Andorran Banking, to make available to the public an account number in each entity in the country to receive donations intended to alleviate the situation created by COVID-19 in the Principality.

description: On October 21st, Andorra's Council of Ministers has approved, as already announced on Friday by the Head of Government, Xavier Espot, the Decree stipulating the new extraordinary program of rental aid and mortgage payments for commercial premises most affected by the measures to deal with the situation caused by the SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On October 7 2020, Andorra's Council of Ministers has approved, at the proposal of the head of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, the Decree amending the Regulations governing reimbursement benefits up to 100% derived from COVID-19 for hospital expenses for stays longer than eight days when they include at least one stay in the Intensive Care Unit and for stays longer than sixteen days in conventional hospitalization.
type_text: Economic policy allowing people to be reimbursed for hospital expenses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 11 March, the Andorran Government announces that quarantine (both at hospitals or at private domiciles) will be obligatory when considered necessary by health professionals with the objective of preventing new infections and providing treatment. This policy is part of the first exceptional health measures.
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)

description: "Effective 1 Dec 2021, the government of Andorra will require all travelers arriving from the countries of South Africa, Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia and Zimbabwe to complete a mandatory 10-day quarantine upon arrival and submit a negative COVID-19 test a maximum of 72 hours prior to arrival. After arrival, travelers who submit a negative PCR or TMA test after seven days are permitted to end the quarantine period early. "
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Self-Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at home)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: "Effective 1 Dec 2021, the government of Andorra will require all travelers arriving from the countries of South Africa, Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia and Zimbabwe to complete a mandatory 10-day quarantine upon arrival and submit a negative COVID-19 test a maximum of 72 hours prior to arrival. After arrival, travelers who submit a negative PCR or TMA test after seven days are permitted to end the quarantine period early. "
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Quarantine outside the home or government facility (i.e. quarantine in a hotel)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On 11th March, 2020, the government of Andorra has announced as part of a decree, that all events that expect more than 1000 people are cancelled. Those events that expect less than 1000 people, will be considered case by case. This will take effect during a period no superior to 30 days.

type_sub_cat: All/Unspecified mass gatherings restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: [Restrictions of mass gatherings] On the 14th of July, 2020, the government of Andorra announced that as a preventative measure against COVID-19, all activities will be restricted to 50 people maximum. There will still be a need to keep 1.5m of social distancing and wearing masks. UPDATE: On Apr 8, 2022, according to information published by the tourism authority, proof of vaccination, recovery or a negative test result is no longer required to access tourist accommodation, hospitality settings, events or cultural and entertainment venues in Andorra. Restrictions on gatherings have also been lifted.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: All/Unspecified mass gatherings restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On September 18th 2020, The Andorran Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, has advanced that the new text will limit family groups and also social activities to a maximum of 10 people starting Monday 9/21. In leisure, cultural and sports activities, the limit is maintained at 50 people and, when this figure is exceeded, it will continue with the activation of specific protocols.
type_sub_cat: All/Unspecified mass gatherings restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On September 18th 2020, The Andorran Minister of Health, Joan Martínez Benazet, has advanced that the new text will limit family groups and also social activities to a maximum of 10 people starting Monday 9/21. In leisure, cultural and sports activities, the limit is maintained at 50 people and, when this figure is exceeded, it will continue with the activation of specific protocols. UPDATE: On October 2nd 2020, the Minister of Health explained during his appearance this Friday afternoon that the Government has decided to extend one more week the measures decreed fifteen days ago to strengthen prevention against COVID-19 that limit family groups and also social activities. UPDATE: On November 24th 2020, the government announced that in bars and cafés, the maximum number of people per table is still 2 in indoor spaces, but it will increase to 4 people per table in outdoor services. In restaurants, a maximum of 4 people can be grouped per table, unless the household nucleus is higher. Face-to-face work meetings or meetings with family and friends are also restricted to a maximum of 4 people, unless the household nucleus is higher. As of Apr 8, 2022, restrictions on gatherings have been lifted.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: All/Unspecified mass gatherings restricted
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 11th of March 2020, the government of Andorra has announced as part of a decree, that wearing a mask will be mandatory for residents with symptoms in socio-medical, day-care centers, or retirement homes; when interacting with workers. This will take effect during a period of no more than 30 days.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
target_who_gen: People in nursing homes/long term care facilities

description: On 11th of March 2020, the government of Andorra has announced a decree with new measures to protect vulnerable societal groups. Therefore, socio-medial centers, day-care centers, and hospitals, will from now on limit visits to one relative per resident. Also, visits from those who have had symptoms related to COVID, have been to a risk zone in the last 14 days, or have been in close contact with a probable or confirmed case of COVID; will be prohibited. Workers of said centers with those same symptoms will also be prohibited to work.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting nursing homes/long term care facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Therefore, socio-medial centers, day-care centers, and hospitals, will from now on limit visits to one relative per resident. Also, visits from those who have had symptoms related to COVID, have been to a risk zone in the last 14 days, or have been in close contact with a probable or confirmed case of COVID; will be prohibited. description: On October 7th 2020, Andorra's Council of Ministers approved this Wednesday the application of new exceptional measures to deal with the health situation caused by COVID-19. The aim of the new decisions is to help curb the rate of reproduction of the pandemic.  The use of the mask is maintained for all extracurricular activities and playgrounds remain closed. With regard to restaurants, the maximum number of five people per table is maintained and they must be separated by the stipulated minimum distances. The commercial premises is limited to 1 person for every 4m.
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Other (Please specify in the text box)
